document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards English Language Arts (NJSLS-ELA)

A614D5BAD9804B689E482C20B2CD98C7.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English
when indicated or appropriate.

6EE99A1A0B3C403E880AFE712B6C0B2F.description:
Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and
findings and emphasize salient points.

B28D83830AD44CCBA30BAEB348194604.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with
pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and
clear pronunciation.

EA6B9FF9FDC849CD8E005EC15011840D.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning
and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

A6710A97952C474A8AF817DA7F5B0F60.description:
Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g.,
visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

4DDFE221E0B04736A6F8FAE253BE055C.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own
views.

F25B36180E93455296B24BD2C0DAB291.description:
Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with
relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

070B11AAD60045999938E80BC02AA3D1.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and
define individual roles as needed.

AA0CD8E3B2E2447EB4822277D64B16E2.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly
draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and
reflect on ideas under discussion.

9DECC10C38A64D4A859E670A2869AD9D.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and
teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and
expressing their own clearly.

08588C82B923449B94B3D4EC7FBB76E2.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, metacognition/selfcorrection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of
discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

3CB9D1D98AB34199921B980191ADDF6A.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms
effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and
conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

34394489F9E043878E2ED2750ED9A5FE.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and
generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

A6904736187B4FEEB39F1127260F187F.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as
needed by planning; flexibly making editing and revision choices and sustaining effort to complete
complex writing tasks; and focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

AA181CEE1A844753879E72322D774FAB.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

8FF3B2B7F20D40E0B6D86DCA48C2E586.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture
the action and convey experiences and events.

106C15F9B8764B22B54AFF7AB72FEF50.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts
from one time frame or setting to another.

BBD12E0D719A4C02B55EF26F85B5CDF5.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences,
events, and/or characters.

5B835D0504634EB0AA25B7428E1D9573.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a
narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

855BF98193FF4E04A1D5CC45580E1303.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique,
relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

D2BF066385F5416E8A7E20E0BD970F9A.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section (e.g., sentence, part of a paragraph, paragraph, or
multiple paragraphs) that follows the flow of ideas, reflects back on the topic, and supports
the information or explanation presented.

8A32C0C9D8A646A8AF1B1D256348762A.description: Establish and maintain a formal style academic style, approach, and form.

6E434AB9D10D40178B68585F14CD4764.description:
Use precise language and domain/ grade-level- specific vocabulary to inform about or
explain the topic.

FA8A7B38548248A7BBE66E6F53C13DBC.description:
Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and
concepts.

D5AED152BDBA42A2964B457B913FEAE2.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples.

FB36EECEB93741D9BEE86AC48286FC49.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and
information, using text structures (e.g., definition, classification, comparison/contrast,
cause/effect, etc.) and text features (e.g., headings, graphics, and multimedia) when useful
to aid in comprehension.

91DEAA5F0AC74159B880EDC3511DA941.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts (including the narration of historical events, scientific
procedures/ experiments, or technical processes) to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and
information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

A0491A6068484965A6507667A34AB29A.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument
presented.

B11630E71B7F445886659AB192CB9E58.description: Establish and maintain a formal style/academic style, approach, and form.

34A5CE0F25B54076A653535608122270.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among
claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

80D05AB2F33F4411BDFFC88B4C33FCFE.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant, accurate data and evidence that
demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text, using credible sources.

65685A1AF34143DCBB4BF5E8A57BECFF.description:
Introduce claim(s) about a topic or issue, acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and
organize the reasons and evidence logically.

665D5D8AF9674CFE8A964F183C0DF415.description:
Write arguments on discipline-specific content (e.g., social studies, science, technical subjects,
English/Language Arts) to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

BA5F342939054DD2A725D1B80DE4EEA7.description:
Analyze and reflect on (e.g., practical knowledge, historical/cultural context, and background
knowledge) how two or more authors writing informational texts about the same topic shape their
presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different
interpretations of facts.

1FB345EE3141451996F76686D838A2B8.description:
Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of an event, time, place, or character and a
historical or scientific account of the same period or event as a means of understanding how authors of
fiction use or alter history and/or events.

F882A86166D24577858F49743AA0FD2B.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning
is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

FA48AB8BF3DF4778B615BAF78E05207F.description:
Compare and contrast texts to analyze the unique qualities of different mediums, including
the integration of information from multiple formats and sources to develop deeper understanding of
the concept, topic or subject and resolve conflicting information.

36852A22DD4041A897D4833FCDF291CA.description:
Compare and contrast texts (e.g., a written story, drama, or poem) to its audio, filmed, staged,
or multimedia version and analyze the unique qualities of different mediums, including the effects of
techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

BC0E9CB30C53421FB44022700887C451.description:
Determine how an author conveys or develops perspective or purpose in a text through
distinguishing their position from that of others using evidence.

79942B0DEE6849B0BA2D3C288FA52BE3.description:
Determine how an author conveys or develops perspective or purpose in a text through
contrasting the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

FEFD1DD9D18B4397AAB2B3F01D43556B.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text and how it contributes to the text as a
whole, including using knowledge of text structures (e.g., cause-effect, proposition-support) and genre
features (e.g., graphics, captions, indexes) to organize and analyze important information.

CE663EE8B3274178A5CA74C91DFD3C8E.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text and how it contributes to the text as a
whole, including how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its
meaning.

3F2B9CF1C3C946FEB0DD25E846B25577.description:
Analyze how particular elements of a text interact including how a text makes connections and
distinctions among individuals, events, and ideas (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

7AEC29CBBDA1411F8831763BC9C3A9A1.description:
Analyze how particular elements of a text interact including how particular lines of dialogue or
incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

520C84A8E54E47C4AD02AE6AFC8674B8.description:
Determine a central idea in an informational text and explain how it is conveyed through
particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

8AEB34F917E342ED9F54EF347CFA51E6.description:
Determine a theme in a literary text (e.g., stories, plays or poetry) and explain how it is
conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or
judgments.

D618EF22282A40AC81920EF8AC475494.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence and make relevant connections to support analysis of
what an informational text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

B4BC357459ED4388AF7CAF05F979A95C.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence and make relevant connections to support analysis of
what a literary text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

65E81C93B76149AC95DD92E629E57F96.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations
(definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

C67913FDC009466FB02F1CAF5B3F7801.description:
Analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sound (e.g., alliteration) on a specific
verse or stanza or a poem or section of a story or drama.

88128F5204B04CCAA057D8071C2E4122.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better
understand each of the words.

31CBD2A7AB354F22964A77090AF1127B.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

898DACD7912A4F1385C856589D43EEF7.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word
meanings.

D1AAAAB4DBCC413EBFC1D8E2674169F0.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking
the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

0B573EC6E754423D8A94310B9D953FC1.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and
digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its
part of speech.

9C6392D025684D7481F08AE1E8E4CD24.description: Analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

30EFCFF6FDC345F6A40A378C7DE6405A.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a
word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

D7A230CB88DC4677B1677DAA381EDCA5.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or
function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

D7DE66657500412FA9C843048EDEB90E.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based
on grade 7 reading and content, including technical meanings, choosing flexibly from a range of
strategies.

548CB966C5AE4E0283592A2E212E07AB.description:
Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating
wordiness and redundancy.

944909609C0646D092253DB75FD33487.description:
Gather vocabulary knowledge when selecting a word or phrase important to comprehension
or expression.

A675390417C8418099A8D437316CD769.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words
and phrases.

F094B67936244118A305BD25EFEE3FD7.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

A7324CE9D92C42978532763317CD2932.description:
Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie
but not He wore an old green shirt).

7C50AB451448422FAE1C1EE7187D368F.description:
Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and
dangling modifiers.

3CE6D1BEE3D04B2A8ADF6F1928C4F37E.description:
Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal
differing relationships among ideas.

457DFCEB3E2E452EAFDD81CD79560F9C.description:
Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific
sentences.

3F70EB2F6DC24317B9EAC473005A6634.description:
Demonstrate command of the system and structure of the English language when writing or
speaking.
